working_definition: Hearing Impairment means an impairment in hearing, whether permanent or fluctuating, that adversely affects a child’s educational performance. This category includes conditions that are not severe enough to be classified as Deafness but still impact learning.

other_names_or_examples_with_definitions.name: Conductive Hearing Loss
other_names_or_examples_with_definitions.definition: A type of hearing loss due to problems with the ear canal, eardrum, or middle ear, often temporary and treatable.

other_names_or_examples_with_definitions.name: Sensorineural Hearing Loss
other_names_or_examples_with_definitions.definition: A permanent hearing loss resulting from damage to the inner ear or auditory nerve.

other_names_or_examples_with_definitions.name: Mixed Hearing Loss
other_names_or_examples_with_definitions.definition: A combination of conductive and sensorineural hearing loss.

other_names_or_examples_with_definitions.name: Fluctuating Hearing Loss
other_names_or_examples_with_definitions.definition: Hearing loss that varies over time due to infections or other temporary conditions.

other_names_or_examples_with_definitions.name: Unilateral Hearing Loss
other_names_or_examples_with_definitions.definition: Hearing loss in only one ear, which can still affect learning, especially in noisy environments.

common_presentations: Needs repetition or clarification during lessons
Misses parts of classroom discussion or peer conversations
Better understanding when visual supports are used
Appears inattentive or off-task due to hearing challenges
Struggles with phonics and auditory-based reading tasks
Fatigue from listening effort during long lessons
Difficulty localizing sounds in group settings

accommodations_modifications.name: Use of FM or soundfield amplification system
accommodations_modifications.how_it_helps: Improves access to auditory instruction by reducing background noise
accommodations_modifications.example: Teacher wears a microphone that transmits directly to student's receiver

accommodations_modifications.name: Preferential seating near the teacher
accommodations_modifications.example: Student sits in the front row on the teacher’s speaking side

accommodations_modifications.name: Speech and language therapy
accommodations_modifications.how_it_helps: Supports expressive and receptive language development
accommodations_modifications.example: Student receives weekly sessions with a speech-language pathologist

accommodations_modifications.name: Teacher repetition and paraphrasing
accommodations_modifications.addresses_presentation: Needs repetition or clarification during lessons
accommodations_modifications.example: Teacher repeats and rephrases questions before asking for responses

accommodations_modifications.name: Closed captioning on videos
accommodations_modifications.how_it_helps: Provides access to spoken content via text
accommodations_modifications.addresses_presentation: Misses parts of classroom discussion or peer conversations
accommodations_modifications.example: Student watches science videos with captions enabled

accommodations_modifications.name: Visual supports and written instructions
accommodations_modifications.how_it_helps: Reinforces auditory information with visual cues
accommodations_modifications.addresses_presentation: Better understanding when visual supports are used
accommodations_modifications.example: Student receives written directions for all class assignments

accommodations_modifications.name: Regular listening checks and comprehension monitoring
accommodations_modifications.how_it_helps: Ensures student is understanding and engaged
accommodations_modifications.addresses_presentation: Appears inattentive or off-task due to hearing challenges
accommodations_modifications.example: Teacher asks student to summarize directions after group instruction

accommodations_modifications.name: Use of visual phonics or cued speech
accommodations_modifications.addresses_presentation: Struggles with phonics and auditory-based reading tasks
accommodations_modifications.example: Student uses hand cues to differentiate similar sounds

accommodations_modifications.name: Frequent breaks during listening-intensive activities
accommodations_modifications.how_it_helps: Reduces cognitive fatigue from sustained listening
accommodations_modifications.addresses_presentation: Fatigue from listening effort during long lessons
accommodations_modifications.example: Student takes short breaks after every 20-minute lesson segment

accommodations_modifications.name: Strategic grouping for peer work
accommodations_modifications.how_it_helps: Facilitates easier communication and sound localization
accommodations_modifications.addresses_presentation: Difficulty localizing sounds in group settings
accommodations_modifications.example: Student is placed in small, quiet groups facing one another
